item.title: Sunflower add a quote by Nelson Henderson
item.description: "The true meaning of life is to plant trees under whose shade you do not expect to sit. " -- Nelson Henderson

item.title: Sunflower add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sunflower add a quote by Alan Fletcher
item.description: "Strap a piece of toast -buttered side up- to the back of a cat. Throw the cat out of the window. Will the cat land on its feet or will Murphy's law apply?" -- Alan Fletcher

item.title: Sunflower add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "All morning I struggled with the sensation of stray wisps of one world seeping through the cracks of another. Do you know the feeling when you start reading a new book before the membrane of the last one has had time to close behind you? You leave the previous book with ideas and themes -- characters even -- caught in the fibers of your clothes, and when you open the new book, they are still with you." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Sunflower add a quote by R.D. Laing
item.description: "Life is a sexually transmitted disease and the mortality rate is one hundred percent." -- R.D. Laing

item.title: Sunflower add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Sunflower add a quote by Sheng Wang
item.description: "Why do people say "grow some balls"? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding." -- Sheng Wang
